message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.GT 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a joint transmission strategy to maximize the sum-rate of two users in an energy harvesting system. This involves optimizing the energy allocation and time fraction of zero-forcing joint transmission. Information theory is closely related to the optimization of communication systems, making this a likely category. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper considers a networked MIMO system with two base stations serving two users cooperatively. The proposed joint transmission strategy involves dividing each transmission frame into two subframes, which is a networking concept. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper introduces an approximate dynamic programming algorithm to determine the energy allocation among frames. This involves controlling the energy usage of the system, making this a possible category. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper considers the problem of maximizing the sum-rate of two users in a cooperative communication system, which can be seen as a multimedia application. 
5. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory): The paper involves optimizing the energy allocation and time fraction of zero-forcing joint transmission to maximize the sum-rate of two users. This can be seen as a game-theoretic problem, making this a possible category.
